Class Circle

java.lang.Object
  Circle

public class Circle
extends java.lang.Object

A circle that can be manipulated and that draws itself on a canvas.

Constructor Summary

          Create a new circle at the default position with the default diameter and color.

Constructor Detail

Circle

public Circle()
Create a new circle at the default position with the default diameter and color.

Method Detail

changeColor

public void changeColor(java.lang.String newColor)
Change the color of this circle. Valid colors are "red", "yellow", "blue", "green", "magenta", "black" and "white". If an unknown color is used the circle will be black.

Parameters:
newColor - The new color of this circle.

changeSize

public void changeSize(int newDiameter)
Change the size of this circle. If the newDiameter is less than zero, the circle will not be visible.

Parameters:
newDiameter - Change this circle's diameter to this given value.

getColor

public java.lang.String getColor()
The accessor for getting this circle's color.

Returns:
Returns this circle's color as a String.

getDiameter

public int getDiameter()
The accessor for getting this circle's diameter.

Returns:
Returns this circle's diameter as an integer.

getIsVisible

public boolean getIsVisible()
The accessor for getting this circle's visiblility.

Returns:
Returns this circle's isVisible field as a boolean. True means this circle is visible. False means this circle is not visible.

getxPosition

public int getxPosition()
The accessor for getting this circle's horizontal xPosition.

Returns:
Returns this circle's xPosition as an integer.

setIsVisible

public void setIsVisible(boolean isVisible)
The mutator for setting this circle's visiblility.

Parameters:
isVisible - True means draw this circle to the screen. False means erase this circle from the screen.
